parameter_sets.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /** \file parameter_sets.h Structures for adding parameters to ensembles
00002         and assemblies.
00003 
00004 Begun on 20080606 by BLFoley
00005 
00006 This file is loaded with the molecules.h header file by default.
00007         It should only be loaded explicitly in a program if, for some reason,
00008         you are using it separately. 
00009 
00010 The parameter_set structure will eventually contain pointers for
00011 just about any type of data typically used in simulations.  As usual,
00012 there is also a void pointer for situations where information is needed
00013 that is not already included in the structure.  In any case, this is
00014 likely to be one whopping big structure, hence the separate file. */
00015 
00016 #if !defined(GLYLIB_PARAMETERS)
00017 #define GLYLIB_PARAMETERS
00018 
00019 /************ sub structures for the parameter_set structure *****************/
00020 typedef struct{ // bond_type
00021         char **NT; // first and second atom types in bond (match NT in atype)
00022         char *desc; // description 
00023         double o; // bond order for this type
00024         double k; // force constant 
00025         double l; // equilibrium length
00026         double kx; // anharmonicity 
00027         double LJD_612,LJZ_612,LJD_1012,LJZ_1012; // Lennard-Jones params (D=depth Z=zero)
00028         double LJ6_612,LJ12_612,LJ10_1012,LJ12_1012; // Lennard-Jones params (alternate)
00029         int nVP ; // number void pointers
00030         void *VP; // the void pointers
00031 } bond_type; // bond types -- for describing bonds
00032 typedef struct { // angle_type
00033         char **NT; // the three atom types (match NT in atype)
00034         char *desc; // description 
00035         double k; // force constant (angular)
00036         double l; // equilibrium angle
00037         double kx; // anharmonicity 
00038         int nVP ; // number void pointers
00039         void *VP; // the void pointers
00040 } angle_type; // for describing angle parameters
00041 typedef struct { // torsion_type
00042         char **NT; // the four atom types (match NT in atype)
00043         char *desc; // description 
00044         int n; // number of terms in this dependence
00045         double *k; // force constant (angular) (n of these...)
00046         double *N; // periodicity (n of these...)
00047         double *P; // phase (n of these...)
00048         int nVP ; // number void pointers
00049         void *VP; // the void pointers 
00050 } torsion_type; // for describing torsion parameters
00051 typedef struct { // atype -- for atom types
00052         int n; // atomic number
00053         char *N; // element name
00054         char *NT; // name for element type
00055         double m; // mass of this atom type 
00056         char *desc; // brief free-form description field
00057         int nb; // number of typical bonds for this atom type
00058         double *bo; // typical bond orders (nb of these)
00059         int nlp; // number of typical lone pairs (to check geometry sanity)
00060         double LJD_612,LJZ_612,LJD_1012,LJZ_1012; // Lennard-Jones params (D=depth Z=zero)
00061         int nch; // number of charges to associate with this atom type
00062         int *ch; // the charges
00063         int nR; // number of radii 
00064         char **RD; // descriptions of the nR radii
00065         double *R; // radii (e.g., van der Waals, Poisson-Boltzmann, etc.)
00066         int nSC; 
00067         double *SC; // some other constant (e.g., screening) associated with R
00068 // Pointers for convenience
00069         int nBT; // number of bond types for this atom
00070         int *iBT; // pointers into a bond_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00071         bond_type **BT; // pointers into a bond_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00072         int nHBT; // number of H-bond types for this atom
00073         int *iHBT; // pointers into a H-bond_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00074         bond_type **HBT; // pointers into a H-bond_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00075         int nNBT; // number of non-bond types for this atom
00076         int *iNBT; // pointers into a non-bond_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00077         bond_type **NBT; // pointers into a non-bond_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00078         int nANT; // number of angle types for this atom
00079         int *iANT; // pointers into a angle_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00080         angle_type **ANT; // pointers into a angle_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00081         int nHANT; // number of H-bond angle types for this atom
00082         int *iHANT; // pointers into a H-bond angle_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00083         angle_type **HANT; // pointers into a H-bond angle_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00084         int nNANT; // number of non-bond angle_types for this atom
00085         int *iNANT; // pointers into a non-bond angle_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00086         angle_type **NANT; // pointers into a non-bond angle_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00087         int nTRT; // number of torsion types for this atom
00088         int *iTRT; // pointers into a torsion_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00089         torsion_type **TRT; // pointers into a torsion_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00090         int nHTRT; // number of H-bond torsion types for this atom
00091         int *iHTRT; // pointers into a H-bond_torsion_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00092         torsion_type **HTRT; // pointers into a H-bond_torsion_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00093         int nNTRT; // number of non-bond torsion_types for this atom
00094         int *iNTRT; // pointers into a non-bond torsion_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00095         torsion_type **NTRT; // pointers into a non-bond torsion_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00096 // The void pointers for expansion
00097         int nVP ; // number void pointers
00098         void *VP; // the void pointers
00099 } atype; // atom types, with other info 
00100 typedef struct { // rtype -- for residue types
00101         int c; // main class (amino acid, glycan, solvent, etc.)
00102         int nac, *ac; // number alternate classes, those classes
00103         int nVP; // number of other information
00104         void *VP; // pointers to the nVP holders of other information
00105 } rtype; // residue types, with other info 
00106 typedef struct { // mtype -- for molecule types
00107         int c; // type class (amino acid, glycan, solvent, etc.)
00108         int nVP; // number of other information
00109         void *VP; // pointers to the no holders of other information
00110 } mtype; // molecule types, with other info 
00111 typedef struct { // types -- container for other type info
00112         int na; // # of atom types
00113         atype *a; // na of these
00114         int nr; // # of residue types
00115         rtype *r; // nr of these
00116         int nm; // # of molecule types
00117         mtype *m; // nm of these
00118         int nVP ; // number void pointers
00119         void *VP; // the void pointers
00120 } types; // superstructure for typing information
00121 
00122 /***************** structure parameter_set ********************/
00123 /* parameters for atoms, molecules, residues, etc. */
00124 typedef struct {
00125         int nAT; // number of atom types represented in this set
00126         atype *AT; // array of atom type structures
00127         int nRT; // number of residue types represented in this set
00128         rtype *RT; // array of residue type structures
00129         int nMT; // number of molecule types represented in this set
00130         mtype *MT; // array of molecule type structures
00131         int nBT;
00132         bond_type *BT;
00133         int nHBT; // for hydrogen bonds
00134         bond_type *HBT;
00135         int nNBT; // for non-bonded interactions
00136         bond_type *NBT;
00137         int nANT;
00138         angle_type *ANT;
00139         int nTRT;
00140         torsion_type *TRT;
00141 } parameter_set;

00143 #endif
